metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4283 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ns-slapd in 389 Directory Server before 1.3.0.8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (server crash) via a crafted Distinguished Name (DN) in a MOD operation request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.3.2.11-0ubuntu1
389-ds-base - 1.3.2.11-0ubuntu1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.3.2.11-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.2.11-0ubuntu1').
